title: Semantic Technology for Web Media Analytics

author: Mark Wong, FXMedia Internet Pte Ltd

segmentation: Mark Wong, director of Eric's Media Singapore Private Limited.
Glad to be here to give us a talk on a semantic technology for web media.

Analytix what I'll be covering today will be on one background and the Web revolution and the industrial landscape in global trends and market, as well as the local scene back in Far East in Singapore.
I will touch on a little bit on the some of the problems that we that we have using the current measurement tools and how we make use of semantic web to solve some of these problems.
After that I will run through a little pilot project that we have done recently.
That would be one of the case study that we're talking about.

And last but not least, before I sign off, I'll be touching on the online media measurement strategy that we adopted an give a list of how the new generation media management tool will probably look like.
Right, background an revolution.
We all start that we've desktop computing right in the PC era where we have mini store out information in our standalone.
Files in our PC then comes with Web 1.0 where people start to share information on the Internet, start to publish HTML pages so and so forth.
Then it start to get a little bit boring and people start to create applications such as forums, blogs, upload photos, videos and so on.
And that's where the term Web 2.0 comes in.

After that that will be looking at Semantic Web viewer.

And at least 70% of them wish that it was easier to compare TV rating on online data.

You know something about you, know something about it, but when you cannot measure it, you cannot express it in numbers.

Play some of the problems and challenges.
One of the main things that our main problems that we have identified is number 1 accuracy.

Sometime will not refer to the same context.
For example when we type Apple is it Apple referring to fruit or is it to computer?
In next is the web of unstructured data Internet make it also spirit difficult to consolidate all this information.
Thirdly, there are companies that we are also aware that there mainly still using a manual method which is very labor intensive.
So manual scan scanning, screening through all the various media sites are slow and subject to errors and appreciate interpretation.
Next is the flexibility changing business scope but also cause the required to change in training staff.
Assess reprogramming of the systems right?
For example Nokia from people new industry to telecommunication industry.
So the context has changed drastically.
Lastly, will be the interfacing of data between application within organization.
So why semantic web?
The semantic web, well, fundamentally isn't unique way of specifying data as well as a data relationships.
So it primarily solve quite a few issues.
#1 accuracy issue, right?
Based on the relation semantic on the same context, this vertical methods of search able to provide more accuracy in gathering data from the from the web and #2.
It also helped the laborers intensive issue with.
Automated data mining process, regardless of how many new media channel that has mushroom up in a short period of time, there's no bottleneck to mine the data.

Application level.

Algorithms alright, so of course for the private cloud.

Otherwise you're going to, well, privacy issues.

Essentially, when we develop this site we already have.
Doing this kind of measure measurement for them, so as part of the exercise we actually cry.
The Facebook page as well as the Twitter page for them and from there we actually start to do some simple tracking.

Quick fast in terms of reaching the information so like for example, in this case we are able to retrieve from the RSS feed the total number of news from X5 Model XV as well as food GSIS Canon power shots, so we're able to view this in the very quick.
Quick manner.

Demographics in terms of the.
How we segment number of news within the?
Product category model right?
How much news or exposure has been given to the particular model?
Give you so we use charts like this to monitor some of the spikes why certain time of the day.
There is a sudden jump in terms of the news feed.
So over here we are able to zoom into the particular news that experience whether competitor has launched a new product and things like.
OK, so moving on we adopted the new online media strategy while doing this project we realized that they are forming key things that we need to take care of.
Number one is listening to what the audience got to say.
#2 promote what we call.
Advocacy program, which means we are able to identify who are the influencer and then have advocacy program tailored for them in the military.
Giving support to the customer customer by resolving some of the issue that they block online and of course Lastly action in identifying what are shortcomings in there.
Dyson, right?
This is moving on.
This is a new interface that we have come up with and some of the key things that we want to highlight would be.
For example, you are able to view the products at the in a hierarchy manner.
Where is it?
Models or category or even at the brand level so you can consolidate all this information for you.
And then we also have like for example automation of pulling the various competitors within that category.
And, uh, we have related campaigns right about them.
So for example, if MX5 have three campaigns in that year, they can easily look through some of the campaigns report's over here, right?
In the middle we have a summary report on how many.
Positive sentiments we have neutral, negative and total number of mentions within the brain.
All that model.
Get on to zoom in.
You can actually look at the blocks and things.
Things like that.
Ann for comparing your competitors, we also generate charts that able to circulate in the various potential percentage of exposure.

The other thing would be the influential, influential, influential pro portion where we are able to rank based on the number of follows the followings, an update and then we can rank this inventor accordingly and this we have an action for them where we will either qualify them for incentive programs and things like that.
OK, next one will be some of the news that we can pack the news with certain events.
And last but not least, we are able to also link it with one of the so called Intranet application which essentially archive all their marketing programs.
OK, that's pretty much I have today.
Thank you very much.
So hello mark.

How do you solve this problem?

Yeah, so until we have master and completely entire system that's running so, then we will look into exploring to other languages.
OK, so you at the moment focused on English and when will what will be the next languages you are focused on?
Probably either French or Spanish.
Thank you.
OK, thanks again to Mark.
Thank you very much.
